attributes.action: recognise that the failure of politicians to deal with the issues inherrent within the West Lothian Question now poses a significant threat to the operation of democracy and undermines the whole credibility of the parliamentary process. We would urge the Prime Minister to take responsibility for resolving this matter, with a view to seeking a resolution within the current parliamentary term.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The West Lothian Question represents a  constitutional crisis brought about by the devolution of the Scottish, Welsh and Northern Ireland's paliamentary processes; in which regional issues are voted upon and decided by representatives of only one particular region. eg. issues affecting Welsh constituents would normally only be decided upon within the Welsh Assembly. This is in contrast to issues affecting the population of England, which are addressed in the House of Commons and voted on by mp's from across the whole of Great Britain.
